thread.title_full: Jason Dundas shares a snap of his naked physique | Daily Mail Online

author: Faye James For Daily Mail Australia
title: Jason Dundas shares a snap of his naked physique | Daily Mail Online
text: Share this article Share Meanwhile, Jason spoke to Daily Mail Australia ahead of the David Jones Autumn/Winter 2017 fashion launch of his desire to marry and be a good role model like his father. The model revealed that the only steady female in his life was a four-month-old cavoodle puppy called Olly. 'I'd love to have that too': Jason Dundas reveals desire to have children and marry but says his nomadic career hasn't let him settle down just yet 'It's a little bit tricky because they is nothing set in stone, so it's hard to give a definitive answer on that one,' Jason answered coyly when asked if he was dating anyone. But the David Jones ambassador said that with many of his friends marrying and having kids now it made him want to have that for himself too. Feeling clucky? The David Jones ambassador said that with many of his friends marrying and having kids now it made him want to have that for himself too 'The love and joy that they get out of having kids, I'd love to have that too one day,' Jason said. 'Obviously I live a bit of a nomadic lifestyle with what I do ... I think it is one of those things that when it is the right time it will happen.' Jason said he would like to be a good father because his own dad, famed statistician Ross Dundas, was such an inspiration for his later success. Success: Born and raised in the suburbs of Western Sydney, Jason rose to prominence working as a VJ for MTV Australia from the age of 21 'My dad was an incredible role model for me, he's an entrepreneur and he has inspired me to do what I do in life,' he said. ' ... He's shown me that I can do anything in life.' Born and raised in the suburbs of Western Sydney, Jason rose to prominence working as a VJ for MTV Australia from the age of 21. Following his father: Jason said he would like to be a good father because his own dad, famed statistician Ross Dundas, was such an inspiration for his later success He found mainstream recognition as a presenter on Channel Nine's Getaway, before taking the ambitious leap overseas to pursue a career in the United States. The gamble paid off, with Jason since landing plum presenting gigs on VH1 and work as a special correspondent on Entertainment Tonight. The television personality now splits his time between Los Angeles and Australia. Nomadic life: Jason now splits his time between Los Angeles and Australia Share or comment on this article 128
